title: devil-soul
author: devil-soul
content: Hi u wanted to know which version of linux between ubuntu, fedora and kali is more suitable for an intermediate level user

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Ubuntu is for developers and testers. It will support any software you want to run on if it is free or not. I think this is the best one for you and it most common.Fedora is only for Free and Open Source Software (FOSS). With this you can not be running software for profit.Kali is more powerful then these other 2. It is used for information security tasks.

comments.author: josephsonand
comments.body: Well, let me tell you, choosing the right Linux distro is like picking the perfect pizza topping - it's a matter of personal taste and what you're craving for! Ubuntu is like the classic Margherita, reliable and beginner-friendly. Fedora is like the spicy Pepperoni, offering cutting-edge features and a vibrant community. And Kali is like the extra-cheesy and intense Meat Lover's, designed for cybersecurity enthusiasts. It all depends on your flavor preferences and what you want to accomplish.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: ubuntu is the easiest as you won't even need the CLI to operate the system. there Synaptic manager to use for installing and removing apps.Â  just pick the newest LTS version because its usually the ones that last for years with repositories support.
